attributes.action: Tax the Difference Between Standard and First Class Travel Costs as a Benefit in Kind
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I believe that travel expenses should be restricted to standard class travel, when a person claims travel expenses that involves first or business class travel then the difference between standard and 'superior' class travel constitues a 'Benfit in Kind' that should be taxed as with other income.

Were the traveller wishes to travel first class pay the difference themselves is perfectly acceptable.

In addition, the full cost of travel by chauffeur driven car should be taxed as a benfit in kind, unless fully paid for by business man.
